Sentencas: Porous materials present serious technological constraints on all applications, such as battery electrodes, solid oxide fuel cells, synthetic bone grafts, filters, pharmaceutical powder compacts and feed pellets.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: Despite the significance of reliability in brittle materials, current literature is limited in pore-pore interaction effects on fracture statistics of brittle porous materials (BPMs).
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: In this paper, a two-dimensional finite element (FE) simulation-based approach was developed to assess the pore-pore interactions and their impact on fracture statistics of isotropic microstructures.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: The classical fracture mechanics approach was combined with FE simulations that account for the interactions to predict the decrease in the fracture stress with increasing porosity.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: Rules were directly compared against experimental data for porous polycrystalline alumina, hydroxyapatite, and all the other data combined in Fig. 6.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: The maximum reliability of BPMs was shown to be limited by the underlying pore-pore interactions.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: Weibull modulus decreased more than threefold for a change in porosity from 1 to 2 vol.%.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: The Weibull moduli were between 7 and 18 in the range of 2-31 vol.% porosity.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity

Sentencas: Even the microstructures with the same porosity level and size of pores showed substantial differences in fracture strength.
Titulo: Stochastic failure of isotropic, brittle materials with uniform porosity
